intro: Macleania coccoloboides, commonly known as the Florida beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces dark purple berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for native plant gardens.
